meanings.definition: Move or shift slightly in a particular direction.
meanings.sent1: The cat scootches closer to the window to catch the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: She scootches her chair a bit to the left for a better view.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel scootches along the branch to reach the juicy nuts.
meanings.sent4: The dancer scootches gracefully across the stage, captivating the audience.
meanings.sent5: He scootches his way through the crowded room, trying not to bump into anyone.

meanings.sent1: He only moved a few scootches to the side to make space for his friend.
meanings.sent2: The snail left a trail of tiny scootches in the sand.
meanings.sent3: She asked for a scootch of sugar in her coffee, just a hint of sweetness.
meanings.sent4: The child measured the distance in scootches, marking each small step.
meanings.sent5: The chef added a scootch of salt to enhance the flavor of the dish.

meanings.definition: To cause to move or shift slightly.
meanings.sent1: He gently scootches the vase to the center of the table for balance.
meanings.sent2: The wind scootches the leaves across the yard in a playful dance.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy scootches the ball out of reach, teasing its owner.
meanings.sent4: The teacher scootches the desks into a circle for group discussion.
meanings.sent5: She scootches the puzzle pieces closer together to see the picture clearly.
